labels.infoTitle: Welcome to the Nonnas of the World
labels.infoDescr: This is a living cookbook and historical archive where grandmothers from every corner of the globe share their culinary wisdom, cultural traditions, and timeless recipes. Add your own Nonna to our growing tapestry of stories, flavors, and memories.
labels.infoDescrAdd: Add your own Nonna's recipe of story, and become part of this growing archieve of love, heritage, and food.

descriptions.fullName: How do you call your grandmother?
descriptions.releaseSignature: I agree to release my signature for this recipe
descriptions.thankYouForYourPurchase: Thank you for your purchase. Your order has been processed successfully.
descriptions.influences: To help us understand the evolution of the food culture of your region, please describe the influences brought to bear on its dishes from politics, religion, class, native climates and geography.
descriptions.grandmotherDesc: What is grandmother in your language, or what your family calls you by?
descriptions.photoDesc: Upload up to 5 pictures of yourself and family, the first will appear on the page under your name, with others appearing on click.
descriptions.bio: Write your story. Use this area to focus on you, including details about your upbringing, family, and legacy.
descriptions.geoHistory: What was it like growing up in your home town? How did your corner of the world shape your life?
descriptions.recipeDesc: Include the recipe of your signature dish here.
descriptions.ingredientsDesc: List all ingredients needed for the recipe, including quantities.
descriptions.directionsDesc: Provide step-by-step instructions on how to prepare the dish.
descriptions.recipeImage: Start with a picture of the dish from your recipe below, and add any images of handwritten recipes, cooking in the kitchen, a family dinner, etc.
descriptions.traditions: Please describe the traditions that connect your family to the cultural roots of your specific region. Include the meaning behind these traditions to help them to live on in public memory.

footer.message: Our site is more than just recipes — it's family traditions, secret tips, and flavors from different cultures.
